Ahmed es-Sikeli (Arabic: احمد السقيلي ‎), born in Djerba to a Berber family of the Sadwikish tribe was baptized a Christian under the name Peter, was a eunuch and kaid of the Diwan of the Kingdom of Sicily during the reign of William I.

Ahmed es-Sikeli, known as Caid Peter (active 1160s), eunuch in the court of Sicily, confidant of Margaret of Navarre; Caïd Richard (died 1187) Great Chamberlain under William I of Sicily and Margaret of Navarre
He sent a fleet under Ahmed es-Sikeli to sack the Balearic Islands in 1159, but the fleet failed to relieve Mahdia, Tunisia which fell on 11 January 1160 along with the "African empire" of Sicily.
